soussou: I kena! Tana mu a ra?

response.soussou: Tanante, Ala xa baraka! I fan?
response.english: Fine, God bless! And you?
response.french: Bien, que Dieu benisse! Et toi?

response.english: I'm coming. Five minutes.
response.french: J'arrive. Cinq minutes.

english: My car is not coming today.
french: Ma voiture ne vient pas aujourd'hui.

response.english: Why? Taxi only?
response.french: Pourquoi? Juste taxi alors?

english: You have a lot going on? / How's your situation?

response.soussou: Eh, travail gbo! Mais ca va.
response.english: Yeah, lots of work! But it's okay.
response.french: Oui, beaucoup de travail! Mais ca va.

response.english: Just peace. Thanks to God.
response.french: Que la paix. Grace a Dieu.

french: Je ne connais pas cet endroit.

response.english: Wait here. I'll come get you.
response.french: Attends ici. Je viens te chercher.

response.english: Just ten thousand. Very fresh!
response.french: Dix mille seulement. Tres frais!

response.soussou: A siga mosquee. A fafe bientot.
response.english: He went to the mosque. He's coming soon.
response.french: Il est parti a la mosquee. Il arrive bientot.

response.english: Yes. I don't have an umbrella.
response.french: Oui. Je n'ai pas de parapluie.

response.english: Sun passed two. Two o'clock.
response.french: Le soleil a passe deux. Deux heures.

response.english: Me too I'm coming. We're coming together!
response.french: Moi aussi j'arrive. On vient ensemble!

response.english: I can't. Tomorrow, okay?
response.french: Je ne peux pas. Demain, d'accord?

english: Go to the market. Buy rice.
french: Va au marche. Achete du riz.

response.english: Okay. How many kilos should I buy?
response.french: D'accord. Combien de kilos j'achete?

soussou: I na minde? N'na i fen gbo!
english: Where are you? I've been looking for you a lot!
french: Tu es ou? Je te cherche beaucoup!

response.english: Sorry! My phone wasn't working.
response.french: Pardon! Mon telephone ne marchait pas.

response.english: Wednesday. Tomorrow is Thursday.
response.french: Mercredi. Demain jeudi.

response.soussou: A cuisine koui. A dege rafe.
response.english: She's in the kitchen. She's cooking.
response.french: Elle est dans la cuisine. Elle prepare a manger.

response.english: I'm coming! What's the problem?
response.french: J'arrive! Qu'est-ce qui se passe?

english: How much is a taxi to go to Conakry?
french: C'est combien le taxi pour aller a Conakry?

response.english: Fifty thousand. But you can negotiate!
response.french: Cinquante mille. Mais tu peux negocier!

response.english: Yes! Drink water. Drink water.
response.french: Oui! Bois de l'eau. Bois de l'eau.

response.english: Yes, he's well. Thanks.
response.french: Oui, il va bien. Merci.

response.soussou: Eh! Nun bi tan whon' a rasa!
response.english: Hey! We just got it today!
response.french: Eh! On vient de l'acheter aujourd'hui!

response.english: Okay, I'll call you. Promise!
response.french: D'accord, je t'appelle. Promis!

english: Where is the road to this hospital?
french: Ou est le chemin de cet hopital?

response.soussou: Siga tout droit, kirin kole. A gauche apres.
response.english: Go straight, at the end. Then left.
response.french: Va tout droit, au bout. Apres a gauche.

response.english: Rice with peanut sauce. You want some?
response.french: Riz sauce arachide. Tu en veux?

response.soussou: Etan birin lafia, Ala xa baraka!
response.english: They're all well, God bless!
response.french: Ils vont tous bien, grace a Dieu!

english: He/she is not coming. He/she is sick.
french: Il/elle ne vient pas. Il/elle est malade.

response.soussou: Ay! Ala xa a kisi! Ana hopital?
response.english: Oh! May God heal him/her! Is he/she at the hospital?
response.french: Oh! Que Dieu le/la guerisse! Il/elle est a l'hopital?

soussou: Whon' kha meeting commence wakhati yiri?
english: What time does our meeting start?
french: Notre reunion commence a quelle heure?

response.english: Nine o'clock. Being late is not good!
response.french: Neuf heures. Le retard c'est pas bon!

response.english: Thank you! You're very generous.
response.french: Merci! Tu es tres genereux.

response.english: Five hundred thousand. Very good quality!
response.french: Cinq cent mille. Tres bonne qualite!

response.english: Let's get inside the house quickly!
response.french: Rentrons vite dans la maison!

response.english: My keys. Have you seen them?
response.french: Mes cles. Tu as vu?

french: Est-ce que tu comprends ma situation?

response.english: Yes, I understand. It's a big problem.
response.french: Oui, je comprends. C'est un gros probleme.

response.english: I'm going to Kindia. Business.
response.french: Je vais a Kindia. Des affaires.

response.english: Hey! Very very hot! Be careful!
response.french: Eh! Tres tres piquant! Attention!

english: How many children do you have?

response.english: Three. Two boys, one girl.
response.french: Trois. Deux garcons, une fille.

response.english: Not long. Just ten minutes.
response.french: Pas longue. Dix minutes seulement.

english: I'm coming, my car is already here.
french: J'arrive, ma voiture est deja la.

response.english: Cool! Wait. I'm coming down now.
response.french: Cool! Attends. Je descends maintenant.

response.soussou: Ay! Gui muxundi gbo! Bougie be?
response.english: Oh! This annoys a lot! Is there a candle?
response.french: Ah! Ca ennuie beaucoup! Il y a une bougie?

response.soussou: A lafia un peu. Fatigue tan.
response.english: He's okay a bit. Just tired.
response.french: Il va un peu. Juste fatigue.

response.soussou: Ntan wama. Merci. I khafe gbo?
response.english: I'm okay. Thanks. You have a lot going on?
response.french: Ca va. Merci. Tu as beaucoup de soucis?

english: What time does the bus leave for Kamsar?
french: Le bus part a quelle heure pour Kamsar?

response.english: Seven in the morning. Fixed departure!
response.french: Sept heures du matin. Depart fixe!

soussou: Awa, ntan kolon. Gui m'ma probleme.
english: Yes, I know. That's not a problem.
french: Oui, je sais. C'est pas un probleme.

response.english: Thank you very much! Clean heart.
response.french: Merci beaucoup! Coeur pur.

english: How much is this palm oil?
french: C'est combien cette huile de palme?

response.soussou: Vingt mille le litre. I ra yiri?
response.english: Twenty thousand per liter. How many do you want?
response.french: Vingt mille le litre. Tu en veux combien?

soussou: Nun bi froid gbo. Hiver fafe.
english: Today is very cold. Dry season is coming.
french: Aujourd'hui il fait tres froid. L'hiver arrive.

response.soussou: Awa. Veste rafa. M'ma vouloir malade.
response.english: Yes. Bring your jacket. I don't want to get sick.
response.french: Oui. Prends ta veste. Je ne veux pas tomber malade.

response.english: A bit strong. Add sugar?
response.french: Un peu fort. Tu ajoutes du sucre?

response.english: She's coming Saturday. By plane.
response.french: Elle vient samedi. En avion.

soussou: Siga droite, apres gauche. Ecole yire.
english: Go right, then left. The school is there.
french: Va a droite, apres a gauche. L'ecole est la-bas.

response.english: Thank you! Is it very far?
response.french: Merci! C'est tres loin?

english: They're all coming to the wedding.

response.english: God bless! Complete family!
response.french: Que Dieu benisse! Famille au complet!

english: Give me that. I need it.

response.english: Take it. But give it back tomorrow!
response.french: Prends. Mais rends-moi ca demain!

response.english: Almost. Three days left.
response.french: Presque. Il reste trois jours.

english: We (not you) are not coming. Too much work.
french: Nous ne venons pas. Trop de travail.

response.english: Too bad! Next time then.
response.french: Dommage! La prochaine fois alors.

english: I understand your situation a lot.

response.english: Thank you. This bothers me a lot.
response.french: Merci. Ca me derange beaucoup.

response.english: This morning! Good smell.
response.french: Ce matin! Bonne odeur.

response.english: I'm coming too! Together!
response.french: Moi aussi je viens! Ensemble!

response.english: Why? Danger?
response.french: Pourquoi? C'est dangereux?

french: Il y a une pharmacie pres d'ici?

response.english: Yes. On the right corner. Five minutes.
response.french: Oui. Au coin a droite. Cinq minutes.

response.soussou: Ntan kolon un peu. N'na apprendre.
response.english: I know a bit. I'm learning.
response.french: Je connais un peu. J'apprends.

response.english: Very! Meetings every day.
response.french: Tres! Des reunions tous les jours.

english: His/her car is coming. He/she is near.
french: Sa voiture arrive. Il/elle est pres.

response.english: Good! I'm going out now.
response.french: Bon! Je sors maintenant.

response.english: Very ripe! Yellow yellow.
response.french: Bien mures! Jaune jaune.

english: Look at me! This is important.

response.english: Okay, I'm looking. What is it?
response.french: D'accord, je regarde. C'est quoi?

english: Are you going to the market?

response.soussou: Awa. I ra besoin di ra?
response.english: Yes. What do you need?
response.french: Oui. Tu as besoin de quoi?

response.english: Oh! I'm scared. Inside the house quickly!
response.french: Ah! J'ai peur. Dans la maison vite!

response.soussou: M'ma yite encore. Retard une heure.
response.english: Not arrived yet. One hour delay.
response.french: Pas encore arrive. Une heure de retard.

response.soussou: A lafia, Ala xa baraka! A i sonyi salam.
response.english: She's well, God bless! She sends you greetings.
response.french: Elle va bien, grace a Dieu! Elle te passe le bonjour.

english: How do I say this in Soussou?
french: Comment je dis ca en Soussou?

response.english: You say: 'Ina mindé'. Easy!
response.french: Tu dis: 'Ina mindé'. Facile!

response.english: Cold or normal?
response.french: Froide ou normale?

english: What time does our office close?
french: Notre bureau ferme a quelle heure?

response.soussou: Six heures. Mais vendredi cinq heures.
response.english: Six o'clock. But Friday five o'clock.
response.french: Six heures. Mais vendredi cinq heures.

response.english: Very good! Well-trained teachers.
response.french: Tres bien! Professeurs bien formes.

english: What about him/her? He/she is not coming?
french: Et lui/elle? Il/elle ne vient pas?

response.soussou: A fafe. Retard un peu tan.
response.english: He/she is coming. Just a bit late.
response.french: Il/elle vient. Juste un peu en retard.

response.english: Thirty thousand. Pure cotton!
response.french: Trente mille. Coton pur!

french: La pluie s'est arretee? Le soleil arrive?

response.english: Yes, clouds are gone. Clear sky.
response.french: Oui, les nuages sont partis. Ciel clair.

english: Is your child going to school?

response.soussou: Awa, CP gui. A aime gbo!
response.english: Yes, first grade this year. He/she loves it!
response.french: Oui, CP cette annee. Il/elle adore!

soussou: Fa fokhora. N'na i rafa kira.
english: Follow me. I'll show you the way.
french: Suis-moi. Je vais te montrer le chemin.

response.english: Thank you very much! Kind.
response.french: Merci beaucoup! Gentil.

response.english: Works very well! No problem.
response.french: Marche tres bien! Pas de probleme.

response.english: Yes, bring it. Important.
response.french: Oui, apporte ca. C'est important.

response.english: Okay. Slowly this time.
response.french: D'accord. Lentement cette fois.

french: Il y a un restaurant pres d'ici?

response.soussou: Awa. Tout droit, gauche apres. Bon manger!
response.english: Yes. Straight, then left. Good food!
response.french: Oui. Tout droit, apres a gauche. Bonne bouffe!

english: They don't know about this problem.
french: Ils ne connaissent pas ce probleme.

response.english: We should tell them. Important!
response.french: On doit leur dire. C'est important!

soussou: Fele bon gbo! Ala xa baraka.
french: Tres belle vue! Que Dieu benisse.

response.soussou: Guinea joli gbo! Whon' kha pays.
response.english: Guinea is very beautiful! Our country.
response.french: La Guinee est tres jolie! Notre pays.

soussou: Siga A yire. A besoin aide.
english: Go to him/her. He/she needs help.
french: Va chez lui/elle. Il/elle a besoin d'aide.

response.soussou: N'na siga maintenant. Khafe mu ra?
response.english: I'm going now. What's the problem?
response.french: J'y vais maintenant. C'est quoi le probleme?

english: How much is a kilo of onions?

response.english: Five thousand. How many do you want?
response.french: Cinq mille. Tu en veux combien?

response.english: Last night. High fever.
response.french: Hier soir. Grosse fievre.

response.english: Wait! My things aren't ready.
response.french: Attends! Mes affaires ne sont pas pretes.

english: Are you able to do this? (genuine question)
french: Est-ce que tu peux faire ca?

response.english: I can. It's not difficult.
response.french: Je peux. C'est pas difficile.

response.english: Not working. Very slow connection!
response.french: Ca ne marche pas. Connexion tres lente!

english: I have a lot going on this week.
french: J'ai beaucoup de choses cette semaine.

response.english: Courage! Next week will be better.
response.french: Courage! La semaine prochaine sera mieux.

response.english: Ten thousand. Very big!
response.french: Dix mille. Tres grosse!

response.english: Not here. At the garage. Repair.
response.french: Pas la. Au garage. En reparation.

response.soussou: Awa! Faim gbo. Di ra dege?
response.english: Yes! Very hungry. What are we eating?
response.french: Oui! Tres faim. On mange quoi?

french: Pars d'ici! Tu n'es pas le bienvenu.

response.english: Okay, I'm leaving. Sorry.
response.french: D'accord, je pars. Pardon.

response.english: Good! Is all the merchandise ready?
response.french: Bon! Toute la marchandise est prete?

response.english: He went to work. Back in the evening.
response.french: Il est parti au travail. Retour ce soir.

response.english: Yes! Price goes up every week.
response.french: Oui! Le prix monte chaque semaine.

response.english: God bless! Great style.
response.french: Que Dieu benisse! Super style.

response.english: Forty thousand. Very big!
response.french: Quarante mille. Tres gros!

soussou: Nuit yite. Whon' sa siga bangui.
english: Night has come. We should go home.
french: La nuit est tombee. On devrait rentrer.

response.english: Yes. Tomorrow we'll meet again.
response.french: Oui. Demain on se revoit.

response.english: Yes! It's very intelligent. Try it!
response.french: Oui! Il est tres intelligent. Essaie!

response.english: Very cold! Added ice.
response.french: Tres froid! Avec de la glace.

soussou: Ala xa whon' kisi! A demain!
english: May God protect us! See you tomorrow!
french: Que Dieu nous protege! A demain!

response.english: Amen! Good night. See you tomorrow!
response.french: Amin! Bonne nuit. A demain!
